name: Marc Eckō's Getting Up: Contents Under Pressure
description: Play as Trane, a "toy" graffiti artist with the street smarts, athletic prowess and vision to become an "All City King" - the most reputable of all graffiti artists. Along your quest, uncover the mayor's deep, dark secret and use your fighting talents and high-wire graffiti to expose the city's leader as a corrupt...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.8 GHz CPU Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 64MB Video Memory, T&L compatible video card DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 3 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card Additional Notes: Wired Xbox 360 Controller Strongly Recommended
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows Vista/7 Processor: 2.2 GHz CPU Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 256MB Video Memory, T&L compatible video card DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 3 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card Additional Notes: Wired Xbox 360 Controller Strongly Recommended

reviews.review_text: An amazing game, a rare treat on steam, if you are into graffiti art this game is for you. This game has some graffiti artists such as COPE2, OBEY, FUTURA, SEEN, T-KID, and SMITH (they play as themselves) and many more artist that are featured. This game also has a great cast such as Talib Kweli, Adam West, Brittany Murphy (R.I.P), Charlie Murphy, Geogre Hamilton, Giovanni Ribisi, Rosario Dawson, The RZA, Sean 'Diddy' Combs, MC Serch, and Andy ♥♥♥♥. Original music by The RZA and RJD2. Gameplay is dated. The story fits with the game and does not feel like a waste of good talent. The graphics do not look bad ps2 quality. The music and the art is true to the graffiti lifestyle. This game is fun and may even inspire some to make art as it did for me. This game works best with a Xbox controller and is working fine on windows 8.1. Thanks to publisher Devolver Digital for bringing this game back.
I like graffiti, and this is simply the best graffiti game there is (even if it's the only). Graphics may feel a bit dated but the gameplay is fine. :)
The checkpoint system and pc port are both awful but if you can get past that theres an amazing game to be had here.
You're able to throw guys into traffic and use a can of spray as a flamethrow while listening to Mobb Deep. 10/10
YES FOUND IT , I LOVE THIS BANNED GAME
Nice style and best game soundtrack!
The pc port is kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥, but the game itself is very good.
Look at the metascore Tell it to go F*ck it self Buy this game
Old school game, Good story, nice gameplay, Yes maybe controls are little bit ♥♥♥♥ed up, but thats not big issue
This is the first game that i finished a few years back,and i loved it so much that i finished it 10 times,the storyline it's awsome.
This is absurd ... we are in 2015's end, and this game ♥♥♥♥ isn't fixed ... basically unplayable

Amazing classic game played this when it was first realsed in 2005 and wanted to play it again for years waiting for it to come on to steam and now i can its so much better second time around. You take the role as Trane a young teen who wants to follow in his father's footsteps as a graffiti artist. The game takes you on action/adventure with hours of gameplay and for an old game the A.I and graphics work very well for old mechanics. Its a absoutle must buy for 6 pound well worth it.
Good game, beat it on the ps2 back in the day.
This is a really good game i was playing it when i was yunger never completed but now i am 17 i have completed it :DD
my mouse sensitivity is way to high can eny one help i played it for the ps2 it was amazing real grity i write now funny were i ended up but yea help?
needs controller support for this amazing game
After my first review, many things changed.  Finally this game is playable with gamepad. Even the resolutions were adjusted.  Now this game is playable and makes fun again.

This game had a lot of potential, but is ruined by a terrible control scheme. The buttons for a lot of things are sort of weirdly placed and the gamepad controls are impossible to use. The graphics are so-so, and the movement for combat is smooth, but the freerunning they expect you to do is stunted and filled with awkward motions and delays that just make the 'experience' rather unimpressive in the end. The music isn't bad and I'd consider getting a copy of the soundtrack to add to my collection of music.
THIS GAME DOESN'T WORK UNLESS YOU HAVE AUTOSAVE DISABLED AND THEN IT CRASHES AND YOU HAVE TO START EVERYTHING AGAIN, ♥♥♥♥ YOU.
Has some OS and camera problems, nothing major, but is well worth the buy for the story and the overall vibe of the game. 9/10 - unique stuff, would love a sequel .

I used to play this game on PS2. A while ago the game was on sale in steam so i decided to give the pc version a try. The most annoying thing is the camera in this game at some angles it can be buggy etc. pieces on the wall start stuttering. Controls can also be a bit buggy. But becide all that it's a great game. I wish they would make a second version of this game!  9/10  Stay Golden

I felt that it was easier to put my thoughts on Hip Hop: The Videogame into a Pro/Con list, so here goes:    Pros:     Levels have a lot of variety   Enemies have a fair amount of variety   Great Soundtrack   Combat is fluid, if but a bit repetitive   Several of the CG cutscenes have great directing and cinematography   Stealth is often encouraged, and when the stealth sections work, they’re great   The bosses are fun, but I just finished it and can only remember two of them, so take from that what you will   Good story    Cons:     The story takes quite a while to get going   Some stealth sections are poor and sometimes it’s just easier to kill the room   This is very clearly a PS2 port, and textures freak out occasionally   The game’s cameraman sometimes forgets his seizure medication   Controls can be janky    Verdict
gives a great early 2000 to 90s feel... one of the games that you will always comeback to and wount die
